sentences.en: A maladroit movement of his hand caused the car to swerve.
sentences.cn: 他的手笨拙的移动使得车突然转向.

sentences.en: A model for the network with swerve penalty ( NSP ) is developed.
sentences.cn: 建立和研究了具有转向惩罚值的网络模型.

sentences.en: Cyclists who swerve to avoid dogs may fall off their bicyles.
sentences.cn: 骑自行车转向躲狗的人非从车上摔下来不可.

sentences.en: Don't race or swerve or suddenly hit your brakes.
sentences.cn: 不要赛车或者忽然转向或者忽然刹车.

sentences.en: Drivers coming in the opposite direction swerved to avoid the bodies.
sentences.cn: 从反方向过来的司机们突然转向以避开这些尸体。

sentences.en: He swung the car to the left and that swerve saved Malone's life.
sentences.cn: 他猛地将车头转向左边，这才保住了马隆的性命。

sentences.en: I don't think he will swerve from his ideas.
sentences.cn: 我看他不会改变主意的.

sentences.en: I will never swerve from it.
I will never swerve from my declared policy on this matter.
sentences.cn: 我绝不改变在这件事上我已宣布的看法.

sentences.en: Just then she had to swerve again.
sentences.cn: 刚说完她就不得不又转了个弯.

sentences.en: Nay, they are a people who swerve from justice.
sentences.cn: 不然, 他们是悖谬的民众.

sentences.en: Nothing will swerve him from his aims.
sentences.cn: 什么也不能使他改变目标.

sentences.en: Ordinary vehicles should swerve away and let fire trucks pass first.
sentences.cn: 普通车辆应当闪让消防车辆,使其先通过.

sentences.en: The car made a sudden swerve to avoid the child.
sentences.cn: 汽车突然转弯,以避开那个小孩.

sentences.en: We put the helm hard over in an attempt to swerve.
sentences.cn: 我们把船尽量往一边靠以便转向.

trans.tran_en: to make a sudden sideways movement while moving forwards, usually in order to avoid hitting something
to make a sudden sideways movement while moving forwards, usually in order to avoid hitting something
